  read_csv("Selection_specimen_GAB_end_04032019.csv", col_types =

                   AccuracyGBIF = col_character(),
                   AccuracyDroissart = col_double(),
                   Accuracy = col_double(),
                   Kept_analysis = col_character(),
                   Updated_data_Trop = col_character(),
                   LowerName = col_character(),
                   `Maximum Day` = col_double(),
                   `Maximum Month` = col_double(),
                   `Maximum Year` = col_double(),
                   `Ecological Habitat` = col_character(),
                   `Ecological Substrate` = col_character(),
                   `Ecological Seasonality` = col_character(),
                   `Ecological Site` = col_character(),
                   ChildHerbNb = col_character(),
                   `Uploaded Trop` = col_character(),
                   DeterminationYear = col_character()
                   ))

## field with problems in importation
problems(dataset) %>%
  distinct(col)

problems(dataset) %>%
  filter(col=="LatitudeDecimal") %>%
  distinct(actual)

problems(dataset) %>%
  filter(col=="DeterminationYear")

 distinct(col)

# Endemism characteristics

## Specimens number
```{r nb specimens, echo=FALSE, message = FALSE, warning=F, fig.height = 10, fig.width = 10, fig.cap='Figure 1: Number of taxa with given number of specimens'}

#### Specimen number by species

nb_occ_tot <- 
  dataset %>% 
  count (NameNoAuthors) %>%  # compte le nombre de specimens par espece
  rename(Tot = n) # renomme la colonne "n" en "Tot"

# Avec condition
nb_occ_crit <- 
  dataset %>% 
  filter (grepl("Klaine", CollectorString)) %>% # lignes qui ont comme collecteur "Klaine"
  count (NameNoAuthors) %>%  # nb de specimen par espece avec cette condition
  rename("Klaine" = n)

result_crit <- inner_join (nb_occ_tot, nb_occ_crit, by="NameNoAuthors")


## Plot nb especes en fonction nb de specimens
# Choix des limites de regroupement (nb de spÃ©cimens)
nb_gp <- nb_occ_tot %>% summarise (g1=sum(Tot==1), g2=sum(Tot==2), g3=sum(Tot>=3 & Tot<=5), g4=sum(Tot>5 & Tot<=10), g5=sum(Tot>10 & Tot<=30), g6=sum(Tot>30))
gp <- tibble(Nb_spec=c("1","2","3-5","6-10","10-30",">30"),Nb_esp=unlist(c(nb_gp[,1:6])))
gp <- gp %>% 
  mutate(Perc= round(Nb_esp/sum(Nb_esp)*100,1))

# Plot
gp$Nb_spec <- factor (gp$Nb_spec, levels=c("1","2","3-5","6-10","10-30",">30")) # obliger de mettre cette donnee en facteur pour que ggplot prenne en compte cet ordre de donnees pour ploter

ggplot(data=gp,aes(x=Nb_spec,y=Nb_esp)) + 
  geom_bar(stat="identity") + 
  geom_text(aes(label=paste(Perc,"%",sep="")),vjust=1.6,color="white", size = 8) + 
  xlab("Number of specimens") + 
  ylab("Number of taxa") + 
  theme(axis.text=element_text(size=18, color ="black"), axis.title=element_text(size=18,face="bold"))

```


## Taxonomy
```{r taxo fam end stat nb, echo = FALSE, fig.height = 10, fig.width = 10, fig.cap='Figure 2: Proportion of families within endemic taxa'}

#### Most representative families within endemics

end_fam_nb <- end_esp_anal %>% # calculate nb of species per family within endemics
  count (FAMILY) %>% 
  mutate (n = as.numeric (n)) %>% 
  arrange(-n) %>%  # sort by decreasing order
  mutate (prop=round(n/sum(n)*100,1))


# Plot - Most represented families in endemics

X = 10 # The top X families with most endemic species will be dispayed

# fam_low <- end_fam_nb %>% # Calculate nb of families with less than X species

  ylab("Taxa number") + 
  geom_text(aes(label=paste(prop,"%",sep="")), vjust=1.6, color="white", size = 6) +

```



```{r taxo fam end stat prop, echo = FALSE, fig.height = 10, fig.width = 10, fig.cap='Figure 3: Families of Gabon with highest proportion of endemic taxa. Number of taxa in the family is indicated in red and number of endemic taxa in the family is indicated in green within the bar'}

#### Most representative families with highest proportion of endemic taxa

full_gab_fam_nb <- full_gabon %>% # calculate nb of species per family within Gabonese flora
  filter (tax_esp != "###") %>% # remove specimens not identified at species level
  distinct (tax_tax, tax_fam) %>%  # all taxa with associated family
  count (tax_fam) %>% # count for number of taxon in each family
  mutate (n = as.numeric (n)) %>%
  arrange(-n) %>% 
  rename("FAMILY" = tax_fam)

end_fam_prop <- left_join(end_fam_nb, full_gab_fam_nb, by= "FAMILY") %>%  # calculate proportion of endemic species within each family in Gabon
  rename ("n_end" = n.x) %>% 
  rename ("n_gab" = n.y) %>% 
  mutate (prop_full = round(n_end/n_gab*100,1)) %>% 
  arrange (-prop_full) %>% 
  filter(n_gab > 5) # filter families with more than 5 species


# Plot - Most represented families in endemics compare to Gabonese flora

X = 15 # The top X families with most proportion of endemic will be dispayed
ggplot(data=end_fam_prop %>% top_n(X), aes(x=reorder(FAMILY,-prop_full), y=prop_full)) + 
  geom_bar(stat="identity") + 
  xlab("Families") + 
  ylab("Proportion (%)") + 
  geom_text(aes(label=n_gab), vjust=1.2, color="red", size = 6) +
  geom_text(aes(label=n_end), vjust=2.8, color="green", size = 6) + 
  theme(axis.text=element_text(size=18, color ="black"), axis.title=element_text(size=18,face="bold"), axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1, vjust=0.3))

```

## Habitus
```{r habitus RB, eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}

#### Species habitus according to Rainbio data

habit_RB<-dataset %>% 
  filter (!is.na(`Ecological LifeForm`)) %>% 
  group_by(NameNoAuthors) %>%
  distinct(`Ecological LifeForm`)

nb_habit_RB <- habit_RB %>% 
  group_by(NameNoAuthors) %>%
  summarise(n = n_distinct(`Ecological LifeForm`))

habit_unique <- nb_habit_RB %>% 
  filter (n == 1) # to select data that have only one type of habitus in Rainbio data

Habitus <- habit_RB [habit_RB$NameNoAuthors %in% habit_unique$NameNoAuthors,]

# Distribution characteristics

```{r grid of Gabon, echo= FALSE}
# Define grid for Gabon
CS=0.4 # size in decimal degree of cell size
grid_gab <- st_make_grid(gabon, n=c(diff(st_bbox(gabon)[c(1, 3)]), diff(st_bbox(gabon)[c(2, 4)]))/CS, square = FALSE)

grid_gab <- as_tibble(grid_gab) %>% # integrate numero of cell in grid
  mutate (ID_grid = c(1:length(grid_gab))) %>% 
  st_as_sf ()
```



```{r distrib sampling heat map, echo= FALSE}

#### Heat map of number of specimen per cell

full_gabon_sf_grid <- st_intersection(full_gabon_sf, grid_gab) # add number of grid cell to each specimen

nb_spec_grid <- full_gabon_sf_grid %>% 
  count(ID_grid)  # count number of specimen per grid cell

grid_gab_nb_spec <- left_join(as_tibble(grid_gab), select(as_tibble(nb_spec_grid), ID_grid, n), by = "ID_grid") %>% # integrate nb of specimens per cell to the grid data
  mutate (n = as.numeric(n)) %>% 
  rename (n_spec_full = n) %>% 
  st_as_sf ()

# Plot
# hist(log10(grid_gab_nb_spec$n_spec_full))

sampling_plot <- ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(data=grid_gab_nb_spec$geometry, aes(fill=grid_gab_nb_spec$n_spec_full)) + 
  scale_fill_gradient(low="lightyellow", high="red", name = "Number") + 
  geom_sf(data=gabon$geometry, color = "black", size = 1.5, fill = NA) + 
  geom_sf(data=PNgabon$geometry, color = "#006600", size =1, fill = NA) + 
  geom_sf(data=road$geometry, color = "black", size = 0.6) + 
  geom_sf(data=city$geometry, size = 3) + 
  geom_sf_text(data=city$geometry, aes(label = city$VILLE), nudge_y = 0.2, size=4, fontface ="bold") + 
  ggtitle ("A.") +
  theme (plot.title = element_text(size = 24, face = "bold"), axis.text=element_text(size=18, color ="black"), axis.title=element_blank(), legend.title=element_text(size=20, face="bold"), legend.text=element_text(size=16))
  
```



```{r distrib esp end heat map, echo= FALSE}

#### Heat map of number of endemic species per cell

# Integrate data in grid - Number of endemic species per grid cell
dataset_sf_grid <- st_intersection(dataset_sf, grid_gab) # add number of grid cell to each specimen ; need to put point first then polygon for intersection

nb_esp_end_grid <- dataset_sf_grid %>% 
  group_by(ID_grid) %>% 
  summarise(count_esp_end_grid =  n_distinct(NameNoAuthors)) # count number of distinct species per grid cell

grid_gab_nb_esp_end <- left_join(as_tibble(grid_gab), select(as_tibble(nb_esp_end_grid), ID_grid, count_esp_end_grid), by = "ID_grid") %>% # integrate nb of species per cell to the grid data
  mutate (count_esp_end_grid = as.numeric(count_esp_end_grid)) %>% 
  mutate(count_esp_end_grid = replace_na(count_esp_end_grid,0)) %>% 
  st_as_sf ()


# Plot
# hist(grid_gab_nb_esp_end$count_esp_end_grid)

endemic_nb_plot <- ggplot() + 
  geom_sf(data=grid_gab_nb_esp_end$geometry, aes(fill=grid_gab_nb_esp_end$count_esp_end_grid)) + 
  scale_fill_gradient(low="lightyellow", high="red", name = "Number") +

```{r resampling richness grid stat, echo = FALSE}

#### Extrapolation - Calcul estimator of total species richness (Chao, Walther and Moore (2005))

K = round(seq(1, nrow(full_gabon %>% filter (tax_esp != "###") %>% select (tax_tax)), length.out = 1000), 0)
chao2 <- vector()

for (i in 1 : length (K)){
subsamp <- sample_n(full_gabon %>% filter (tax_esp != "###") %>% select (tax_tax), size = K[i], replace = FALSE)
subsamp_count <- subsamp %>%
  count(tax_tax) %>% 
  rename (nb = n)
chao2[i] <- length(unique(subsamp$tax_tax)) + ((sum(subsamp_count$nb==1)*(sum(subsamp_count$nb==1)-1))/(2*(sum(subsamp_count$nb==2)+1)))
print(i)
}

## ---> result: no real plateau of accumulation, show that Gabon is not well collected; inflexion of curve appears for n(specimen) is ca. 30000! so need 30000 specimen to make a quite good estimation of total richness, which is for a grid cell very too much !  So we can't use extrapolation to calculate total richness per grid cell and use % of endemism to calculate estimated number of endemic species per grid cell.


#### Interpolation - resampling per grid cell : use to compare grid cell one to another to highlight grid cell with higher proportion of endemism

#   mutate (endemic = replace_na(endemic, "non-endemic")) %>% # add "non-endemic"" if species is non-endemic
#   rename (NameNoAuthors = tax_tax) %>%

spec_grid <- left_join(as_tibble(grid_gab), select(as_tibble(nb_spec_grid), ID_grid, n), by = "ID_grid") %>% # integrate nb of specimens per cell to the grid data
  mutate (n = as.numeric(n)) %>% 
  rename (n_spec_full = n)

k = 200 # value of minimal number of specimen in a grid cell to compute resampling
rep = 1000
resampling_result <- grid_gab


for (i in 1 : nrow(grid_gab)) {
tot <- vector()
end <- vector()
  if (!is.na (spec_grid$n_spec_full[i]) & spec_grid$n_spec_full[i]>k) {
    for (j in 1 : rep){
      subsamp <- sample(pull(as_tibble(full_gabon_sf_grid) %>% filter (ID_grid == i) %>% filter (tax_esp != "###") %>% select (tax_tax)), size = k, replace = FALSE) # pull allows to make a vector from a column tibble
      tot[j] <- length(unique(subsamp))
      end[j] <- length(unique(subsamp %in% end_esp_all$SPECIES))
    }
  tot <- sort(tot)
  end <- sort (end)
  resampling_result [i,3] <- mean(tot)
  resampling_result [i,4] <- tot[around(0.05*rep,0)]
  resampling_result [i,5] <- tot[around(0.95*rep,0)]
  resampling_result [i,6] <- mean(end)
  resampling_result [i,7] <- end[around(0.05*rep,0)]
  resampling_result [i,8] <- end[around(0.95*rep,0)]
  }
print(i)
}

resampling_result <- resampling_result %>% 
  rename (mean_tot = V3, min_conf_tot = V4, max_conf_tot = V5, mean_end = V6, min_conf_end = V7, max_conf_end = V8)
